greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the total number of terms (1-digits) in Zeckendorf representation of all divisors of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10946
example: For n=12, its divisors are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6 and 12. Zeckendorf-representations (A014417) of these numbers are 1, 10, 100, 101, 1001 and 10101. Total number of 1's present is 10 (ten), thus a(12) = 10.
program: A072649(n) = { my(m); if(n<1, 0, m=0; until(fibonacci(m)>n, m++); m-2); }; \\ From A072649
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 18 2018
